data.chText: （尤指用手指或手快速地）轻击，轻拍，轻拂，轻弹
data.enText: to hit sth with a sudden quick movement, especially using your finger and thumb together, or your hand

data.chText: 她轻轻弹掉了衣领上的灰尘。
data.enText: She flicked the dust off her collar.

data.chText: 马轻轻甩动尾巴把苍蝇赶走。
data.enText: The horse was flicking flies away with its tail.

data.chText: 詹姆斯朝她轻轻弹一颗花生。
data.enText: James flicked a peanut at her.

data.chText: 请勿把烟灰弹在地毯上！
data.enText: Please don't flick ash on the carpet!

data.chText: （使）突然快速移动
data.enText: to move or make sth move with sudden quick movements

data.chText: 蛇伸吐着信子。
data.enText: The snake's tongue flicked out.

data.chText: 她的眼光扫过人们的脸。
data.enText: Her eyes flicked from face to face.

data.chText: 他抬起头，拂开了脸上的头发。
data.enText: He lifted his head, flicking his hair off his face.

data.chText: 马甩着尾巴走开了。
data.enText: The horse moved off, flicking its tail.

data.chText: 向…笑了一下（或瞥了一眼等）
data.enText: to smile or look at sb suddenly and quickly

data.chText: 她紧张不安地瞟了他一眼。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: She flicked a nervous glance at him.

data.chText: 她紧张不安地瞟了他一眼。
data.enText: She flicked him a nervous glance.

data.chText: （快速地）按（开关），按（键）；打开（或关闭）
data.enText: to press a button or switch quickly in order to turn a machine, etc. on or off

data.chText: 他啪的一声按了下开关，灯全熄了。
data.enText: He flicked a switch and all the lights went out.

data.chText: 她轻轻一按打开了电视机。
data.enText: She flicked the TV on.

data.chText: （用…）轻挥，轻打
data.enText: to move sth up and down with a sudden movement so that the end of it hits sth

data.chText: 他用湿毛巾轻打我。
data.enText: He flicked me with a wet towel.

data.chText: 他用湿毛巾轻打我。
data.enText: He flicked a wet towel at me.

data.chText: 用鞭子抽打
data.enText: to flick a whip
flick through sth

data.chText: 浏览；草草翻阅
data.enText: to turn the pages of a book, etc. quickly and look at them without reading everything

data.chText: 我的时间不多，只是草草翻阅了一下你的报告，但似乎还不错。
data.enText: I've only had time to flick through your report but it seems to be fine.

data.chText: 快速浏览，不停地变换（电视频道）
data.enText: to keep changing television channels quickly to see what programmes are on

data.chText: 我快速浏览电视频道，发现有一部老的战争片在放映。
data.enText: Flicking through the channels, I came across an old war movie.

data.chText: （用鞭子等的）轻打；（身体部位的）快的小动作
data.enText: a small sudden, quick movement or hit, for example with a whip or part of the body

data.chText: 贝尔迅速插进禁区助攻，创造了这次进球的机会。
data.enText: Bell's flick into the penalty area helped to create the goal.

data.chText: 这所有的信息只需按一下开关便可到手。
data.enText: All this information is available at the flick of a switch (= by simply turning on a machine) .

data.chText: 他手腕一抖把球传了回来。
data.enText: He threw the ball back with a quick flick of the wrist .

data.chText: 浏览；草草翻阅
data.enText: a quick look through the pages of a book, magazine, etc.

data.chText: 我等待时浏览了目录。
data.enText: I had a flick through the catalogue while I was waiting.

data.chText: 电影
data.enText: a film/movie

data.chText: 电影院
data.enText: a cinema

means: (尤指用手指或手快速地)轻击
向…笑了一下(或瞥了一眼等)

data.enText: flick through sth

data.chText: 浏览；草草翻阅
data.enText: to turn the pages of a book, etc. quickly and look at them without reading everything

data.chText: 我的时间不多，只是草草翻阅了一下你的报告，但似乎还不错。
data.enText: I've only had time to flick through your report but it seems to be fine.

data.chText: 快速浏览，不停地变换（电视频道）
data.enText: to keep changing television channels quickly to see what programmes are on

data.chText: 我快速浏览电视频道，发现有一部老的战争片在放映。
data.enText: Flicking through the channels, I came across an old war movie.

tr: a form of entertainment that enacts a story by sound and a sequence of images giving the illusion of continuous movement
example: they went to a movie every Saturday night
the film was shot on location

tr: a light sharp contact (usually with something flexible)
example: he gave it a flick with his finger
he felt the flick of a whip

tr: remove with a flick (of the hand)
touch or hit with a light, quick blow
cause to make a snapping sound
throw or toss with a quick motion
example: flick a piece of paper across the table

tr: cause to move with a flick
look through a book or other written material

example: The lights flicked on and off

value.def: If something flicks in a particular direction, or if someone flicks it, it moves with a short, sudden movement.

example.ex: His tongue flicked across his lips...
example.tran: 他的舌头迅速舔了一下嘴唇。

example.ex: The man's gun flicked up from beside his thigh...
example.tran: 那个男人迅速从大腿一侧抽出枪来。

example.ex: His glance flicked round my face and came to rest on my eyes...
example.tran: 他的视线扫过我的面庞，然后停留在我的眼睛上。

example.ex: He flicked his cigarette out of the window.
example.tran: 他把香烟从窗口弹了出去。

value.def: If you flick something away, or off something else, you remove it with a quick movement of your hand or finger.

example.ex: Shirley flicked a speck of fluff from the sleeve of her black suit...
example.tran: 雪莉弹掉了黑色套装袖子上的一点小绒毛。

example.ex: Alan stretched out his hand and flicked the letter away.

value.def: If you flick something such as a whip or a towel, or flick something with it, you hold one end of it and move your hand quickly up and then forward, so that the other end moves.

example.ex: He helped her up before flicking the reins...
example.tran: 他帮她上马，之后挥动了缰绳。

example.ex: She sighed and flicked a dishcloth at the counter...
example.tran: 她叹了一口气，然后用洗碗布轻掸着柜台。

example.ex: The jockey said he tended to flick horses with the whip.
example.tran: 骑手说他经常会用鞭子抽马。

value.def: If you flick a switch, or flick an electrical appliance on or off, you press the switch sharply so that it moves into a different position and works the equipment.

example.ex: He flicked a light-switch on the wall beside the door...
example.tran: 他啪的一声打开了门边墙上的电灯开关。

example.ex: Sam was flicking a flashlight on and off...
example.tran: 萨姆啪啪不停地把手电筒开了又关。

value.def: If you flick through a book or magazine, you turn its pages quickly, for example to get a general idea of its contents or to look for a particular item. If you flick through television channels, you continually change channels very quickly, for example using a remote control.

example.ex: She was flicking through some magazines on a table...
example.tran: 她正翻看着桌上的几本杂志。

example.ex: I'll just flick through the pages until I find the right section...
example.tran: 我会快速地翻页，直到找到要找的那一部分。

example.ex: He switched on the television, flicking through the channels in a search for something to hold his interest.
example.tran: 他打开电视机，不停地换台，想找个感兴趣的节目。

example.ex: I thought I'd have a quick flick through some recent issues.
example.tran: 我想我得快速浏览一下最近发生的事情。

value.tran: 快速翻阅;浏览;不停地转换(电视频道)

trans: 女性电影(旨在迎合女性口味的电影)
